intro: Cyphostemma glandulosopilosum, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. Cyphostemma glandulosopilosum is often found in woodland and rocky habitats, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
